text: Syngenta Group is a global
agricultural input company.
We want to grow more with less,

and we really want to maximize
that through input reduction
and maximizing our yield for our growers.

We've seen a very strong
strategic partner with AWS.

We've got lots of
infrastructure already there
so it was easy lift for us to add on
Amazon Bedrock to really bring

that forward. What we've
done is we've created
a tool we call Cropwise AI.

Cropwise AI is built on
the foundation of Bedrock,

allowing us to enable
multiple large language
models like Anthropic
to really bring forward a conversational
enablement for our customers.
With our Cropwise AI and product

placement technology,
we've actually been able

to increase that speed
to market by five times.

So a five x improvement in
efficiency for our sales reps

to work with the growers
to make product placement
much more efficient.

Being able to complex
process all of the decisions

that you have to make with
weather, soils, and the inputs,

and then really giving that to
a decision, reduces the input

that the grower had to
put into their land,

and ultimately maximizing
that yield out of there.
As climate change comes in diseases,

insects are moving at a
faster pace of change.

We have to have that information
at growers fingertips

and for them to act immediately
to preserve the crop
and the food that we all need

and what they need in their
daily lives.
